New music for July 2015

Written by Brandon King · Published Jul 1, 2015

Communion by Years & Years

First album from the electronica trio who won the BBC Sound of 2015 award.

Blood by Lianne La Havas

An album that that shakes, shimmies and swings from the up and coming singer-songwriter.

Work it out by Lucy Rose

Second album from the tea-loving folk singer, overseen by Mumford & Sons producer Rich Cooper.

Amused to death by Roger Waters

Remix of a 1992 concept album from the Pink Floyd bassist. Inspired by Neil Postmanâ€™s book Amusing Ourselves to Death, where he argues that people become addicted to the technologies that take away their capacity to think.

Water for your soul by Joss Stone

Four years in the making, this album incorporates elements of reggae and hip-hop.

Brandon King

I work in the Suffolk Libraries Stock Team
